forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 52. West wind 5 to 9 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Sunny then Light Rain Likely
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 5pm. Mostly sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 3 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As night envelops Downtown San Francisco, a gentle haze drapes the city, the skies partly obscured by clouds that hint at a more tumultuous day to come. The air, fresh and cool, carries the whisper of impending rain, teasing the senses with a bouquet of earthy anticipation. With a low settling around 52 degrees, the evening calls for light layers; a sweater or jacket would serve well against the slight chill that dances on the breeze.

Tomorrow, the mellow light of day will give way to rain, likely beginning after five. A unique character emerges from the mix, promising a brief respite of sunshine before the clouds reclaim the sky. Daytime temperatures linger around a modest 62, dipping to a cooler 60 in the afternoon as the weather shifts. A gentle west-southwest wind, with moments of briskness, reminds one of autumn's playful temperament. Navigating the city in such weather, consider a leisurely stroll along the waterfront, perhaps stopping in a cozy café to savor a warm drink while the world outside becomes a watercolor of grays and greens—a moment to reflect as the landscapes soften under a light drizzle. The marine layer will likely cloak the bridge, inviting tales of fog and history to surface in the collective memory of this iconic locale.
